answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Julia,
I found some resources for you in this area. I wasn't able to find any specific SLAs, but here are some things that detail SLAs and a job description including the requrement to manage SLAs.
This white paper talks about Emergency Telecommunications Services, and discusses (toward the middle of the doc, page 5) SLAs.
https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=4&ved=0CFAQFjAD&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.emtel.etsi.org%2FWorkshop%2FNon-presented_papers%2FETS%2520in%2520Evolving%2520Nets%2520v3-0.doc&ei=ru4PUf-lAon-0gHJ6YHQBQ&usg=AFQjCNHOwXHwI3jc2Av0vbkuXzh1nmy-zA&sig2=eL55LpxU8KJB-I8R7QbOqw&bvm=bv.41867550,d.dmQ&cad=rja
Taychon Networks provides SLAs for emergency communications.
http://www.tachyon.com/enterprise/emergency.php
Nashville is advertising a job for Emergency Communications Director, who would be responsible for managing such agreements.
http://agency.governmentjobs.com/nashville/default.cfm?action=viewclassspec&ClassSpecID=49124
I hope this helps. Please let us know if we can be of more help.
Thanks,
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Julia Novak
text: Does any jurisdiction have a SLA between their Police/Fire Departments and local Emergency Communication Center opertions?  If so I would very much appreciate a copy!  Thank you.
title: Emergency  Communications SLA
